subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The St. Louis Blues signed the veteran center Keith Tkachuk to a two-year contract yesterday, one day before he would have become an unrestricted free agent. The Blues traded Tkachuk, a four-time N.H.L. All-Star, to Atlanta in February but reacquired rights to him last week. The trade allowed St. Louis to deal exclusively with Tkachuk until today’s deadline for him to become an unrestricted free agent. Tkachuk, 35, had seven goals and eight assists with the Thrashers, after recording 20 goals and 23 assists for the Blues before the trade.
